intro: Phacelia laxa, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Phacelia laxa is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
